metadata.title: CVE-2022-2867 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
libtiff's tiffcrop utility has a uint32_t underflow that can lead to out ofbounds read and write. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to tiffcrop(likely via tricking a user to run tiffcrop on it with certain parameters)could cause a crash or in some cases, further exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiff-tools - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiff5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
libtiffxx5 - 4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-6ubuntu0.2').
